001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
010import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
011
012/**
013 * Class for handling asynchrounous interrupts.
014 *
015 * <p>By default, interrupts will occur on rising edge. Callbacks are disabled by default, and
016 * enable() must be called before they will occur.
017 *
018 * <p>Both rising and falling edges can be indicated in one callback if both a rising and falling
019 * edge occurred since the previous callback.
020 *
021 * <p>Synchronous interrupts are handled by the SynchronousInterrupt class.
022 */
023public class AsynchronousInterrupt implements AutoCloseable {
024  private final BiConsumer<Boolean, Boolean> m_callback;
025  private final SynchronousInterrupt m_interrupt;
026
027  private final AtomicBoolean m_keepRunning = new AtomicBoolean(false);
028  private Thread m_thread;
029
030  /**
031   * Construct a new asynchronous interrupt using a Digital Source.
032   *
033   * <p>At construction, the interrupt will trigger on the rising edge.
034   *
035   * <p>Callbacks will not be triggered until enable() is called.
036   *
037   * @param source The digital source to use.
038   * @param callback The callback to call on an interrupt
039   */
040  public AsynchronousInterrupt(DigitalSource source, BiConsumer<Boolean, Boolean> callback) {
041    m_callback = requireNonNullParam(callback, "callback", "AsynchronousInterrupt");
042    m_interrupt = new SynchronousInterrupt(source);
043  }
044
045  /**
046   * Closes the interrupt.
047   *
048   * <p>This does not close the associated digital source.
049   *
050   * <p>This will disable the interrupt if it is enabled.
051   */
052  @Override
053  public void close() {
054    disable();
055    m_interrupt.close();
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Enables interrupt callbacks. Before this, callbacks will not occur. Does nothing if already
060   * enabled.
061   */
062  public void enable() {
063    if (m_keepRunning.get()) {
064      return;
065    }
066
067    m_keepRunning.set(true);
068    m_thread = new Thread(this::threadMain);
069    m_thread.start();
070  }
071
072  /** Disables interrupt callbacks. Does nothing if already disabled. */
073  public void disable() {
074    m_keepRunning.set(false);
075    m_interrupt.wakeupWaitingInterrupt();
076    if (m_thread != null) {
077      if (m_thread.isAlive()) {
078        try {
079          m_thread.interrupt();
080          m_thread.join();
081        } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
082          Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
083        }
084      }
085      m_thread = null;
086    }
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Set which edges to trigger the interrupt on.
091   *
092   * @param risingEdge Trigger on rising edge
093   * @param fallingEdge Trigger on falling edge
094   */
095  public void setInterruptEdges(boolean risingEdge, boolean fallingEdge) {
096    m_interrupt.setInterruptEdges(risingEdge, fallingEdge);
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Get the timestamp of the last rising edge.
101   *
102   * <p>This function does not require the interrupt to be enabled to work.
103   *
104   * <p>This only works if rising edge was configured using setInterruptEdges.
105   *
106   * @return the timestamp in seconds relative to getFPGATime
107   */
108  public double getRisingTimestamp() {
109    return m_interrupt.getRisingTimestamp();
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Get the timestamp of the last falling edge.
114   *
115   * <p>This function does not require the interrupt to be enabled to work.
116   *
117   * <p>This only works if falling edge was configured using setInterruptEdges.
118   *
119   * @return the timestamp in seconds relative to getFPGATime
120   */
121  public double getFallingTimestamp() {
122    return m_interrupt.getFallingTimestamp();
123  }
124
125  private void threadMain() {
126    while (m_keepRunning.get()) {
127      var result = m_interrupt.waitForInterruptRaw(10, false);
128      if (!m_keepRunning.get()) {
129        break;
130      }
131      if (result == 0) {
132        continue;
133      }
134      m_callback.accept((result & 0x1) != 0, (result & 0x100) != 0);
135    }
136  }
137}
